gurmukhi: ssoB bsqR rMgqM surMg gyrU AMbrM ] iblok dyv dwnvM mmoh gMDRbM nrM ]454]
transliteration: Sasobh Bastra Ranadan Suran Geroo Anbran|| Bilok Dev Daanavan Mamoh Gaddhraban Naran||454||
translation: Their clothes were beautifully dyed in ochre colour, seeing which the gods and demons, men and Gnadharvas were all fascinated.454.

gurmukhi: jtw iblok jwnÍI jtI smwn jwneI ] ibloik lok loikxM Aloik rUp mwneI ]
transliteration: Jataa Bilok Jaanavijatisamaan Jaan-ee|| Bilok(i) Lok Lokinanadok(i) Roop Maan-ee||
translation: Seeing the matted locks of the sage, the Ganges was considering him as Shiva and the beings of all the worlds accepted him as one containing supernatural elegance;

gurmukhi: bjMq cwr ikMgurI BjMq BUq pY DrM ] ppwq j`C ikMnRxI mmoh mwnnI mnM ]455]
transliteration: Bajant Chaar Kinguribhajant Bhoop Pai Dharan|| Papaat Jachchh Kinnranimamoh Maanani Manan||455||
translation: All the beings, in His fear, playing on the fiddle, were repeating His Name; the Yaksha and Kinnar women were all getting allured.455.

gurmukhi: bicqR nwir icqRxI pivqR icqRxM pRBM ] rrIJ j`C gMDRbM surwir nwir su pRBM ]
transliteration: Bachitra Daar(i) Chitranipavitra Chitranan Prabhan|| Dareejh Jachchh Gaddhraban Sudaar(i) Daar(i) Su Prabhan||
translation: The beautiful Chitarni (a kind of women) women, getting pleased on that poure Lord, the women of Yakshas, Gandharvas and gods, were remembering Him;

gurmukhi: kVMq kRUr ikMnRxI hsMq hws kwmxI ] lsMq dMqxo duqM iKmMq jwxu dwmxI ]456]
transliteration: Kadant Kroor Kinnranihasant Haas Kaamannde|| Lasant Danndano Doutan Khimant Jaan(u) Daamannde||456||
translation: The evil Kinnar women were getting angry and other pretty ladies laughingly exhibited their teeth making the lightning shyful.456.

gurmukhi: dlMq pwp du`BrM clMq mon isMmrM ] suBMq Bwr gvM ptM ibAMq qyj auPxM ]
transliteration: Dalant Paap Doubbharan Chalant Mon Sinmaran|| Soubhant Bhaar Gadan Patan Beant Tej Ouphanan||
translation: Seeing him, the formidable sins were destroyed and the silent remembrance of the Lord was the natural outcome; on their bodies, their garments were keeping under control the rising radiance;

gurmukhi: prMq pwn BUcrM BRmMq srb qo idsM ] qjMq pwp nrbrM clMq prmxo mgM ]457]
transliteration: Parant Paan Bhoocharan Bhramannd Sarab To Disan|| Tajant Paap Narbaran Chalant Dharmano Mahan||457||
translation: The beings of all the directions, wandering and coming there, were falling at his feet; all the beings forsaking their sins were following the path of Dharma on reaching there.457.

gurmukhi: iblok bIrxo dXM Aru`J CqR krmxM ] qjMiq swiekM isqM ktMq tUk brmxM ]
transliteration: Bilok Beerno Dayan Arujjh Chhatra Karmanan|| Tajant(i) Saaekan Sitan Katant Took Barmanan||
translation: There he saw two kshatriya fighters absorbed in their actions of war; the warriors were abandoning their bows and cutting the armours; seeing that fighting;

gurmukhi: QQMq Bwnxy rQM iblok kauqkM rxM ] igrMq ju`Dxo iCqM bmMq sRoxqM muKM ]458]
transliteration: Thathanbh Bhaanano Rathan Bilok Kaoutakan Ranan|| Girant Juddhno Chhitan Bamannd Srontan Moukhan||458||
translation: The chariot of the sun stopped there and there the fighters falling on the earth, were throwing out blood from their mouths.458.

gurmukhi: iPrMq c`kRxo ckM igrMq joDxo rxM ] auTMq kRoD kY hTI TTu`ik kRu`iDqM BujM ]
transliteration: Phirant Chakkrano Chakan Girant Jodhano Ranan|| Outhant Krodh Kai Hathithathrk(i) Kruddhitan Bhujan||
translation: The discs were being discharged and the fighters were falling; the persistent warriors were again rising in anger;

gurmukhi: BRmMq A`D b`DqM km`D b`DqM ktM ] prMq BUqlM BtM bkMq mwrUVy rtM ]459]
transliteration: Bhramannd Addh Baddhatan Kamaddh Baddhatan Katan|| Parant Bhntalan Bhatan Bakant Maroode Ratan||459||
translation: Having been cut into half in the form of headless trunks were wandering and those falling on the earth were shouting “kill, kill”.459.

gurmukhi: ippMq AsvM BtM iBrMq dwrxo rxM ] bhMq qICxo srM JlMq Jwl KVigxM ]
transliteration: Pipant Asvan Bhatan Bhirant Daarano Ranan|| Bahant Teechhano Saran Jhalant Dhaal Khadginan||
translation: The horses of the warriors were fighting in that dreadful war; the sharp arrows were being seen;

gurmukhi: auTMq mwrUVo rxM bkMq mwrxO muKM ] clMq Bwij nw hTI juJMq du`DrM rxM ]460]
transliteration: Outhant Maroodo Ranan Bakant Maarnau Moukhan|| Chalant Bhaaj(i) Naa Hathijujhant Duddaran Ranan||460||
translation: The fighters were rising with the shouts of “kill, kill”; and they were not running away from that battlefield with persistence.460.

gurmukhi: ktMq kwrmM suBM bicqR icqRqM kiRqM ] islyix au`jlI kiRqM bhMq swiekM suBM ]
transliteration: Katant Kaarman Soubhan Bachitra Chitratan Kritan|| Silen(i) Ujjalikritan Bahant Saaekan Soubhan||
translation: All were cutting one another in a strange way and the white arrows like the slab were flowing (like a stream);
